name: Command Injection
description:
This application lets the user `dig` a server.
Your goal is to execute commands on the server and find the file "secret".
Don't forget: it's all a matter of user input validation !
resolved_conclusion:
This vulnerability is common when dealing online software services.
.
As always, be carefull with user inputs !

When validating user input, use a whitelist as much as possible, not a blacklist ! It's way more secure.
Also consider passing arguments directly to the executable and not through a shell (do not use sh -c 'cmd').
